greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered factorizations of n into 2 kinds of 2, 3 kinds of 3, ...
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n*Sum_{d divides n, d<n} a(d)/d, n>1, a(1)=1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2002
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ -n^(1+r) / ((1+r)*Zeta'(r)), where r = A107311 = 1.728647238998183618135103010297... is the root of the equation Zeta(r) = 2. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 02 2019
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = x + 2*A(x^2) + 3*A(x^3) + 4*A(x^4) + ... - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 10 2019
For n > 0, a(n) = n * A074206(n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2021
mathematica: a[1]=1; a[n_]:=a[n]=n*Sum[If[d==n,0,a[d]/d], {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 02 2019 *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Oct 15 1999
